alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Racine; Walworth (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 10:26PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Occasional light freezing rain and sleet will develop late tonight and continue on Tuesday. Total ice accumulations of up to a quarter of an inch. Minor sleet accumulation possible. * WHERE...Racine, Walworth and Kenosha Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible late tonight and Tuesday. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute on Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures remain above freezing from Racine and Kenosha into the Lake Geneva and Delavan areas early this evening. Patchy light rain and drizzle has developed. Temperatures are expected to cool to or below freezing later tonight, increasing the chance for light freezing rain and drizzle.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
